issues.description: The problem statement’s UML declares Stock.add(String): void, but the template (and solution) implements add(String) to return an int. This return‐type mismatch between spec and code can confuse students when they try to follow the UML but see a different signature in the starter code.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML in the problem statement to specify add(String): int (instead of void), so it matches the method signature in the template and solution.
